metadata.feature_description: Automatically authenticate users based on their IP address ranges

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure single IP address for auto-authentication

steps.action: Navigate to Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.expected: Site Settings tab displays with Auto-login IP Address field
steps.actual: Site Settings tab displayed with Auto-login IP Address (Optional) field visible

steps.action: Enter single IP address '192.168.1.100' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: IP address is entered in the field
steps.actual: IP address '192.168.1.100' was entered successfully in the Auto-login IP Address field

steps.expected: Settings are saved and IP address is persisted
steps.actual: Settings were saved successfully. LDAP status message appeared (FAIL expected as no AD server). IP address '192.168.1.100' was preserved in the field after save.

steps.action: Enter IP range '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.254' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: IP range is entered in the field using dash notation
IP range is saved and persisted
steps.actual: Settings were saved successfully. IP range '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.254' was preserved after save.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure multiple IP ranges separated by semicolons

steps.action: Enter multiple IP configurations '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.100;10.0.0.1-10.0.0.50;172.16.0.100' separated by semicolons
steps.expected: Multiple IP ranges and single IPs can be entered separated by semicolons
steps.actual: Multiple IP configurations were entered successfully: two IP ranges and one single IP, all separated by semicolons
Settings were saved successfully. All IP configurations '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.100;10.0.0.1-10.0.0.50;172.16.0.100' were preserved after save.

steps.action: Enter invalid IP address '192.168.1' (only 3 octets) in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: Invalid IP format should be detected
steps.actual: Invalid IP '192.168.1' was entered in the field

steps.action: Click 'Update Authentication Settings' to attempt save
steps.expected: Validation error should appear preventing save
steps.actual: Validation error displayed: '192.168.1 is not a valid IP address' with red X icon. Settings were not saved. Validation correctly rejected the incomplete IP address.

observations: LDAP connection status messages (FAIL) appear after each save, which is expected since no Active Directory server is configured in the test environment
The Auto-login IP Address field accepts: single IPv4 addresses, IP ranges using dash notation (start-end), and multiple entries separated by semicolons
IP validation requires exactly 4 octets - partial IPs like '192.168.1' are correctly rejected with clear error message
Code review confirms validation logic in Settings.ascx.cs CheckEnteredIPAddr() method validates each IP has 4 octets and uses Utilities.GetIP4Address() for validation
